column4: hey all :) can someone please explain whats so good about this "ubuntu" thing? all of my friends are talking about it and saying how great it is, and i wanna understand some more about it...
what is exactly that... "ubuntu" :D?
it's a linux distribution, aimed at being user-friendly
lot of things are automated, it's debian-based
nothing is ``better'' than anything else
choosing an operating system is a choice of personal taste and what you want to do with your machine
first of all, linux is free, non-proprietary, open source. everyone may use it and you don't need to pay for licenses
one drawback is that there are still many apps that you simply don't have when you use linux
and under windows, the ``device driver thing'' is a lot easier
wine is, as a matter of fact, still in beta state, not really finished
better pastebot it
do you have aptitude or synaptic running?
no
hm, but looks like it... one moment
if you really don't have anything running, you could `sudo rm /var/lib/dpkg/lock`
and then try again
wait i will try
the truth is i can't even run synaptic, everytime i open it, it gets closed by itself
while that lock-file exists no front-end to apt-get will start
thanks, it works now
np
what do i do when a program tells me "Could not open /dev/sequencer. and another program is probably using it"?
